snippet: The three-judge panel ruled the gay marriage bans violated the federal Constitution, thereby increasing the number of states where same-sex marriage will be legal to 21.
abstract: Federal appeals court in Chicago declares bans on same-sex marriage in Indiana and Wisconsin to be unconstitutional; ruling adds to growing list of marriage equality cases that could be tried before Supreme Court in coming year.
lead_paragraph: The three-judge panel ruled the gay marriage bans violated the federal Constitution, thereby increasing the number of states where same-sex marriage will be legal to 21.

headline.main: Gay-Marriage Bans Fall in Wisconsin and Indiana
headline.print_headline: Gay-Marriage Bans Fall in Wisconsin and Indiana

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
